website_summaries.verdict: Lenovo clearly listened to feedback about last year's high-end Yoga, keeping the excellent overall design but boosting the specs to match other premium 13-inch laptops.
pros: The Lenovo Yoga 900 keeps the slim watchband-style hinge from last year's version, and adds major upgrades to performance and battery life
Even the lowest-cost version includes a big 256GB SSD
cons: Because of the change to more powerful processors, the body adds a little thickness
A few keys on the keyboard suffer from awkward placement

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue with this laptop is the keys. The will pop off with the slightest pressure from the side. I lost a key at a coffee shop, and support could only send me an entire new keyboard to replace, not just one key. Also the replacement keyboard was of an even poorer quality. If I bought something else, I would probably have gotten a mac again. I would recommend this laptop to someone that really doesn't like macs, but I feel the keyboard is less than great.
customer_reviews.author: Konrad

customer_reviews.title: A speedy, lightweight 2-in-1
customer_reviews.text: This convertible 2 in 1 computer is just what I needed. Once it is setup you can switch seamlessly between laptop and tablet mode. It's fast and responsive, too. It works well with the software I use regularly, like Scrivener and Dragon Naturally Speaking, and is ultra-light compared with laptops I've had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Hurley Hall

You can't find it in a store and need to order it online, so when it craps out, it's extremely inconvenient for no reason. I don't see any reason why it has to be some bizarre proprietary port size other than greed. And it's a little too big to be portable. Other than that, it's good.

customer_reviews.title: Good Laptop Overall, but make sure you like the keyboard placement
customer_reviews.text: The Good: powerful CPU, lightweight, HD screen, touchscreen, nice style, is fast and powerful. The 13.3 screen is just about perfect for me. I wouldn't have it any smaller. The Bad: the right shift key isn't partial size, key depth is too shallow, the power cord is too short. Overall good laptop, the only things I would change is a full shift key when typing and longer power cord. There is no perfect laptop but the tradeoffs are worth it.

customer_reviews.title: and the display is beautiful. One word of WARNING - the right shift ...

If you are going to do any real work or word processing on this, I would recommend looking for a different machine.

Lenovo just keeps wanting to replace parts. Is this what my life of owning this laptop will be? $1600 for a laptop and it is repeatedly failing at 30 days. I just requested to return it to Lenovo. I don't believe that it will be problem free or reliable, and will look to purchase another laptop from another manufacturer. How disappointing......

customer_reviews.title: Nice price for features without durability and average keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Comes with decent set of features for a decent price. The laptop hasn't held up to time very well through normal wear and tear. The touch screen became flunky easily when it incurred only a minor fall (e.g. random touches to make the mouse cursor jump). The battery seemingly died overnight or something in the motherboard became broken. I had to replace the battery and still can only turn on my laptop using the BIOS button. The keyboard is pretty terrible with bad responsiveness. These incidents don't seem like coincidence, and I assume it points to poor assembly and poor quality assurance testing.

customer_reviews.title: Yoga 900: Great Successor to the Yoga 3 Pro, the best laptop ever!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great successor to the Yoga 3 Pro. The performance is much better, with an Intel Core i7 processor, the RAM is now at 16GB standard, the hard drive is still that very fast 512GB SSD, and battery life is up by 50% Lenovo still has the great 3200*1800 screen resolution, and it's still very thin and light. The hinge is more sturdier, and still looks and feels great. It's all made of magnesium alloy, which feels great in the hand and screams 'quality!'

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop - Extinct Configuration
customer_reviews.text: The Yoga 900 is a fantastic laptop.However this configuration with i7-6500, only has Intel HD Graphics 520. The latest configuration available directly from Lenovo (on their website), has the updated i7-6560 with Iris 540 graphics for the SAME price. Now the naming system might make you believe that the performance improvements are trivial. This is NOT the case. The updated configuration has a massive (almost 40%) improvement in graphics performance, with all other characteristics (including battery life) remaining the same. I would not recommend this model, unless the price drops by a few hundred dollars.
